_header: Lewd men be not lered in lore / As clerks been in holy writ
Subjects: dialogues; Virgin Mary, as speaker in debate; Bernard of Clairveaux, saint; Passion
_description: Dialogue between St. Bernard and the Virgin Mary concerning the Passion — in 8-line stanzas (abababab)

BodLauMis463.First Lines:
LEwede men þat beoþ not lent in loreAs clerkes beoþ
                    in holy writþei men reden hem beforeIt wile not wonen in here
                    wit…
BodLauMis463.Last Lines:
…& saue vs fro þe feond feloun& bring oure soules
                    into heuen
BodLauMis463.Attributed Title:
Meditacio beati Bernardi super passione domini nostri Ihesu cristi
                    (f. 159v)

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
Lewed men be not lered in loreAs Clerkes ben in holi
                    writ…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…Whon we schul dye and henne goSchilde vs from þe pyne of
                    helle. Amen
BodEngPoeta1.Attributed Title: a gret lamentacion be twene vr ladi & seint Bernard (see 1978)
